clean_content:
Definition / general

* Reactive inflammatory fibrous hyperplastic lesion that can be the result of chronic irritation, most frequently due to ill fitting dentures

Essential features

* Benign reactive inflammatory hyperplastic lesion that is the result of chronic irritation* Histologically is composed of squamous mucosa overlying a dense collagen proliferation with focal chronic inflammation* It is most commonly associated with ill fitting dentures

Terminology

* Epulis fissuratum, denture epulis, fibroepithelial hyperplasia, fibrous hyperplasia, fibroepithelial polyp, fibroma, fibrous epulis ([Head Neck Pathol 2019;13:103](30693455), [Tex Dent J 2009;126:172](19280909))

ICD coding

* ICD-10: [K13.6](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/K00-K95/K00-K14/K13-/K13.6) - irritative hyperplasia of oral mucosa

Epidemiology

* Middle aged and older adults, female predominance ([Acta Histochem 2016;118:451](27132705), [Head Neck Pathol 2019;13:103](30693455), [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1974;37:401](4591192), [Quintessence Int Dent Dig 1984;15:699](6591235))* Denture wearers ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1974;37:401](4591192), [Quintessence Int Dent Dig 1984;15:699](6591235))

Sites

* Oral cavity: gingiva, alveolar ridge ([J Oral Maxillofac Pathol 2014;18:S86](25364187), [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1974;37:401](4591192))

Pathophysiology

* Chronic trauma / irritation leading to exaggerated tissue repair with accumulation of collagen in the submucosal connective tissue ([Acta Biomed 2022;93:e2022219](36300240), [Med Oral Patol Oral Cir Bucal 2019;24:e305](31011141))

Etiology

* Chronic trauma ([Tex Dent J 2009;126:172](19280909))* Poorly fitting dental prosthesis ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1974;37:401](4591192), [Med Oral Patol Oral Cir Bucal 2019;24:e305](31011141))
    ul

Clinical features

* Either single or multiple folds of flesh colored tissue ([Tex Dent J 2009;126:172](19280909), [Head Neck Pathol 2019;13:103](30693455), [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1974;37:401](4591192))* May be ulcerated ([Tex Dent J 2009;126:172](19280909), [Head Neck Pathol 2019;13:103](30693455), [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1974;37:401](4591192))

Diagnosis

* Clinical diagnosis based on clinical features (folds of tissue) and the presence of a poorly fitting denture ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1974;37:401](4591192), [Quintessence Int Dent Dig 1984;15:699](6591235))

Prognostic factors

* Benign lesion; does not recur if the irritation is resolved ([Tex Dent J 2009;126:172](19280909))

Case reports

* 58 year old man with epulis fissuratum ([SAGE Open Med Case Rep 2021;9:2050313X211063135](34881043))* 70 year old woman with epulis fissuratum ([Pan Afr Med J 2022;41:49](35317487))* 81 year old man with epulis fissuratum ([Clin Case Rep 2021;9:e04440](34295478))* Case series of histopathologic findings of epulis fissuratum ([Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol 1974;37:401](4591192))

Treatment

* Surgical excision of tissue and remake or reline of ill fitting denture* Submission of excised tissue is recommended, as malignancies (e.g., metastatic or primary) rarely may clinically mimic denture epulides

Clinical images

Contributed by Michael Piepgrass, D.M.D.  

[![Redundant soft tissue folds](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityinflamfibroushyperplasiaClinPiepgrass1.JPG)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityinflamfibroushyperplasiaClinPiepgrass1.JPG)

Redundant soft tissue folds

[![Hyperplastic tissue mandibular alveolar ridge](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityinflamfibroushyperplasiaClinTh2.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC8917454/figure/F2/)
â€ƒ
[![Hyperplastic tissue mandibular alveolar ridge](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityinflamfibroushyperplasiaClinTh3.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC8647225/figure/fig1-2050313X211063135/)

Hyperplastic tissue mandibular alveolar ridge

Gross description

* Mucosal covered tissue with tan-white cut surface

Gross images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityinflamfibroushyperplasiaGrossTh1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC8917454/figure/F6/)

Mucosal covered fibrous tissue

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Hyperplastic keratinized squamous mucosa overlying dense nodular connective tissue and variable inflammatory infiltrate ([Acta Histochem 2016;118:451](27132705), [Head Neck Pathol 2019;13:103](30693455))* Underlying connective tissue is variably collagenized with scant bland spindled fibroblasts ([Head Neck Pathol 2019;13:103](30693455))* Pseudoepitheliomatous hyperplasia or secondary candidal colonization may be present

Microscopic (histologic) images

[![Squamous mucosa with chronic inflammation](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityinflamfibroushyperplasiaMicroLott2.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityinflamfibroushyperplasiaMicroLott2.jpg)

Squamous mucosa with chronic inflammation

[![Squamous mucosa, chronic inflammation and fibrosis](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityinflamfibroushyperplasiaMicroLott3.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityinflamfibroushyperplasiaMicroLott3.jpg)

Squamous mucosa, chronic inflammation and fibrosis

[![Squamous mucosal lined polypoid structure](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityinflamfibroushyperplasiaMicroLott4.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityinflamfibroushyperplasiaMicroLott4.jpg)

Squamous mucosal lined polypoid structure

[![Polypoid mucosal lined fibrous tissue](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityinflamfibroushyperplasiaMicroLott5.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityinflamfibroushyperplasiaMicroLott5.jpg)
â€ƒ
[![Polypoid mucosal lined fibrous tissue](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityinflamfibroushyperplasiaMicroLott6.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityinflamfibroushyperplasiaMicroLott6.jpg)

Polypoid mucosal lined fibrous tissue

Sample pathology report

* Mandibular alveolar ridge, excision:
  + Inflammatory fibrous hyperplasia (epulis fissuratum)

Differential diagnosis

* [Pyogenic granuloma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavitypyogenicgranuloma.html):
  + Also known as lobular capillary hemangioma+ Pedunculated ulcerated gingival mass that bleeds easily+ Histologically a vascular proliferation resembling granulation tissue with surface ulceration* [Peripheral giant cell granuloma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavityperipheralgiantcellgranuloma.html):
    + Reactive lesion caused by irritation or trauma+ Histologically numerous multinucleated giant cells+ Background of ovoid to spindle shaped cells with extensive hemorrhage* [Drug induced gingival hyperplasia](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavitygingivalhyperplasia.html):
      + Can be caused by calcium channel blockers, antiseizure meds or cyclosporine+ Can look identical to a denture epulis
